channel.title: interfaces on Akhil Sasidharan
channel.description: Recent content in interfaces on Akhil Sasidharan

item.title: Using interfaces in golang to write testable code
item.description: I like golang’s interfaces. They’re just a bunch of function signatures. Simple. Any user-defined type can satisfy multiple interface types at once. Which is why I could easily read a file and pass that to my function that takes an io.Reader interface. *os.File implements the Read(b []byte) (int, error). 1 2 3 4 // the io.Reader interface type Reader interface { Read(p []byte) (int, error) }
